intro: Leucopogon concurvus, commonly known as the narrow-leaved heath, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes shrubs and small trees adapted to acidic soils. The plant features small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in spring. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, contributing to its hardy nature in coastal and sandy environments. Leucopogon concurvus is often found in heathlands and coastal dunes, where it plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local biodiversity.
